snippet: The Afghan leader says he believes that bringing Washington around to his way of thinking is the biggest problem for his government, several Afghans said.
abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai, who views United States as an unreliable ally, is seeking a firm commitment on number of American troops that will remain in Afghanistan past 2014, as well as a mutual security pact; fears that Washington's attempt to open peace talks with Taliban is an attempt to exclude him.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: Sharifullah Sahak and Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Kabul, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Afghan leader says he believes that bringing Washington around to his way of thinking is the biggest problem for his government, several Afghans said.
